Package templeengine.src.core

Class GameCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • templeengine.src.core.GameCanvas
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsteroidsGame, PuzzleGame

    public abstract class GameCanvas
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameCanvas is the backbone of the game itself.

    This is the class you want to extend when starting off with the game. With this class extended all you need to do is call is its constructor, and from within call this constructor and then Temple.enter(this)

    After entering the Temple the engine will call load() and start the game loop. The game loop automatically updates every GameObject in the objects list. You can easily add objects to the list by calling addObject(GameObject o).

    Example code on how to set up a GameCanvas properly. 

    
 import templeengine.src.core.GameCanvas;
 import templeengine.src.core.Temple;

 public class Example extends GameCanvas {

  public Example(String name, double cameraWidth, double cameraHeight, double sceneWidth, double sceneHeight) {

      super(name, cameraWidth, cameraHeight, sceneWidth, sceneHeight);
      Temple.enter(this);
   }

  //@Override
  public void load() {
      //start game here
  }
 }
